# Getting Started

This app is very easy to run on any machine or host.

# Installation

All you need to run the project, is Docker.

# Sail

Recommended way to run the project is using Sail.

./vendor/bin/sail up -d --build

# Docker

If you can't/don't want to run the app using Sail, you can use plain Docker.

docker-compose up -d --build

# Configuration

In progress...

# Directory Structure

The Laravel Skeleton is kept as provided out of the box. Below, the custom folders and their purposes are specified.

# App

This folder contains most of the custom logic.

# Abstracts

Contains partially implemented classes that serve as base classes for other components.

# Collections

Manages data chunks within Laravel, providing utilities for data manipulation and handling.

# Contracts

Holds interface definitions that are typically resolved within service providers.

# Facades

Provides a static interface to classes that are available in the application's service container.

# Services

Contains concrete classes that are often used for binding in the service container.
